intro: Microglossa petiolaris, commonly known as the Christmas fern, is a delicate evergreen fern native to North America. It features a distinctive, narrow, lance-shaped leaf that is often curled in a rosette, resembling a Christmas tree, hence its common name. The plant has a short, underground rhizome and produces spore-bearing structures called sori on the underside of its fronds. It thrives in shaded, moist environments and is often found in woodland areas. Microglossa petiolaris is valued for its ornamental appeal and its ability to add a touch of greenery during the winter months.
